title: GenerateResource Task: Missing resources
body:
### Issue Description
When generating a StronglyTypedClass from a resx file in Visual Studio (Language: German), the comments within the generated class are german as expected.
When using the msbuild task GenerateResource from the command line, the comments are english.

### Steps to Reproduce
* Open Visual Studio and set the language to German
* Create a .NET Standard project
* add a resx file 
* configure the csproj file to generate a StronglyTypedClass from the resx:
````
<Project Sdk="Microsoft.NET.Sdk">
  <PropertyGroup>
    <TargetFramework>netstandard2.1</TargetFramework>
  </PropertyGroup>

  <ItemGroup>
    <Compile Update="Resources\AppResources.Designer.cs">
      <DesignTime>True</DesignTime>
      <AutoGen>True</AutoGen>
      <DependentUpon>AppResources.resx</DependentUpon>
    </Compile>
  </ItemGroup>

  <ItemGroup>
    <EmbeddedResource Update="Resources\AppResources.resx">
      <Generator>PublicResXFileCodeGenerator</Generator>
      <LastGenOutput>AppResources.Designer.cs</LastGenOutput>
    </EmbeddedResource>
  </ItemGroup>
</Project>
````

* open the generated AppResources.Designer.cs. The output looks like this:
 ```
/// <summary>
    ///   Eine stark typisierte Ressourcenklasse zum Suchen von lokalisierten Zeichenfolgen usw.
    /// </summary>
  ...
    public class AppResources {
 ...
```

* regenerate the class using "msbuild -t:ResGen". The output looks like this:
```
/// <summary>
    ///   A strongly-typed resource class, for looking up localized strings, etc.
    ///   This class was generated by MSBuild using the GenerateResource task.
    ///   To add or remove a member, edit your .resx file then rerun MSBuild.
    /// </summary>
   ...
    public class AppResources {
...

```
### Expected Behavior
The comments in a generated StronglyTypedClass are in the same language as msbuild's CultureInfo.CurrentCulture

### Actual Behavior
The generated comments are always english.

### Analysis
The visual studio resources are located in this satellite assembly: 
C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft Visual Studio\2019\Professional\Common7\IDE\PrivateAssemblies\de\System.Design.Resources.dll > System.Design.de.resources

These resources (System.Design.de.resources) are missing in msbuild's satellite assembly: 
C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft Visual Studio\2019\Professional\MSBuild\Current\Bin\de\Microsoft.Build.Tasks.Core.resources.dll

### Versions & Configurations
Windows 10 x64
Visual Studio 2019
msbuild 16.7.0.37604

nodes.body: Note to self: Set up a VM in german, install VS and set language to german and repro it.
Sorry this fell through the cracks! Is this still an issue?

I'm not sure if this still occurs but for me it isn't a problem anymore - we removed those generated classes from version control. So we don't see those "pseudo changes" when committing resource changes. Will close for now.
